item.title: Computer Science II - Lecture 02
Computer Science II - Lecture 01
item.description: Computer Science II basically continues where CS I left off. Both lectures are based on a script that is split into two parts. These weeks lecture introduced pointers. Therefore I'll keep it short because there already a lot of posts for lectures regarding pointers on this page :) and at this point is not really a new or special topic. Pointers Every variable has a memory adress. In case of arrays the base adress of the variable points to the beginning of an array eg the &a is the same adress as &a[0].
